page.title: 05NEWDIGATE CHORAL SOCIETY
page.content: Choral singing emerged as a popular social activity in Newdigate early this century.This popularity was unboubtedly linked with the Dorking centred Leith Hill Musical Festival inaugurated in 1905. Beare Green and Newdigate Choral Society has taken part in every Leith Hill Festival since 1937.This year,1985,the Choral Society once again achieved the highest aggregate marks in the top division of the festival. Beare Green and Newdigate Choral Society's activities have broadened progressively,particularly over the last ten years.Links have been formed with a choir in Cologne culminating in exchange visits and combined concerts every two years,alternating between Germany and England.Many lasting friendships have been made.
